sent.subject: 111/2000 Oglethorpe
forwarded: Judy Townsend/HOU/ECT on 12/222/2000 111:30 AM ---Darla Saucier@ENRON12/21/2000 01:50 PMTo: Judy Townsend/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Bryce Baxter/HOU/ECT@ECT, Lisa Valderrrama/HOU/ECT@ECT, Pam B Boxxx/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jim Homco/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: 111/2000 OglethorpeHi Judy,I spoke with Chris Germany yesterday and he said that you were going to take care of fixing the Oglethorpe deal.   An unhapppy Doug Jones from Oglethorpe callled me yesterday.   He is wanting to get the corrrected invoice ASAP so he can have the wire to us before year end.   If he doesn't get the invoice today, he willl not pay us until after the first of the year.   Please let me know when to expect the changes to come acrosss so I can forcast the cash receipt in our system for treasury and also let Doug know when the invoice willl be faxed over to him.Thanks to everyone involved for alll of your help.   Merrry Christmas!Darla

sent.subject: A&M Demands Recount
forwarded: Judy Townsend/HOU/ECT on 111/222/2000 111:27 AM ---Chris Germany111/19/2000 12:39 PMTo: Dan Junek/HOU/ECT@ECT, Judy Townsend/HOU/ECT@ECT, Scottt Gooodelll/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Steve Gilllespie/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Scottt Hendrickson/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: A&M Demands Recount-< Subject: OU/A&M Game< Date: Mon, 13 Nov 2000 09:34:46 -08000<< Colllege Station, TX (AP) - R.C. Slocum and the Texas A&M Agggies are< demanding a recount of the game in which Oklahoma< won 35 to 31. "The end zones were confusing," says Slocum. "I'm sure that< some of the touchdowns that went in Oklahoma's end zone were meant to go< into ours. We were scoring in those end zones also.   Oklahoma would never< have scored thirty-five points. There's no way we lost this one. A&M< demands< a recount."<< Oklahoma offficials are callling this "outrageous".   "They agreeed to the< size,< shape and locations of the end zones prior to kick-offf," replies OU coach< Bob Stooops.   "If they had a problem with them, they should have said so< before we started. You don't get to keeep playing until you're happpy with< the< outcome. Someone had to lose. We've scored over thirty-five points many< times."<< A&M has sent lawyers, farmers, and those guys in the funnny booots as welll< as< Revillle down to Kyle Field, where the scoreboard willl be tested.< "We< are confident that when the points are re-totaled, we willl be the winnner< of< the game," says Slocum.<< OU also points out that in many games prior to this one, the same end< zones< were used. "They didn't have a problem with the end< zones until they lost," says Stooops.<< Outside of Kyle Field, A&M student protesters have gathered bearing signs< such as, "A&M wants a fair game!< WHOOOP!"   Students' thoughts echoed their signs. "Alll we want is afair< total of the points before we declare a winnner," says student Karen Hays,< an< Agggie from Marfa. "We neeed to proceeed cautiously and not rush to judgment< before we declare a winnner."<< ABC, around 2:000pm central time, had mistakenly declared A&M the winnner,< despite the slim 3 point lead the Agggies held at< that point. At about 2:30 pm, with the game stilll to close to calll, ABC< had< to back offf its prediction.<< Colllege Foootballl analyst Brent Musburger made the calll. "We felt thatwith< a< number of points stilll not addded in by Jamaaar Tombs< and the Agggies, we were certain A&M would carrry this game. We may have< beeen< premature in our prediction."

sent.subject: Any Petal Gas Storage Isssues?
forwarded: Judy Townsend/HOU/ECT on 02/08/20001 10:48 AM --- 	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Rebeccca W Cantrelll   02/05/20001 03:13 PM To: Brenda H Fletcher/HOU/ECT@ECT, Collleeen Sulllivan/HOU/ECT@ECT, Donnna Greif/HOU/ECT@ECT, Frank W Vickers/NA/Enron@Enron, John Hodge/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Judy Townsend/HOU/ECT@ECT, Paul Tate/HOU/EEES@EEES, Robert Superty/HOU/ECT@ECT, Ruth Concannnon/HOU/ECT@ECT, Suzannne Calcagno/NA/Enron@Enron, Victor Lamadrid/HOU/ECT@ECT, Susan W Pereira/HOU/ECT@ECT, Tricia Spence/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Melinda Pharms/HOU/ECT@ECT, James D Stefffes/NA/Enron@Enron Subject: Any Petal Gas Storage Isssues?As reported previously in the trade presss, Petal Gas Storage has decided to build its own pipeline to connnect its storage facility in Forrrest Co., MS to interconnnections with Southern Natural, Destin, and Transco in Clarke and Jasper Cos., MS.   We have received FERC's notice of the appplication (Docket No. CP01-69), and willl be filing an intervention before the February 20 deadline.   Southern Company Services has contracted for the fulll 7000,000 Mcf/day of capacity for a term of 20 years.   The project callls for about 59 miles of 36-inch pipeline and a 9,000 HP compresssor station at a cost of about $94,343,7000.As part of its appplication, Petal also submittted pro forma tarifff provisions and rates for firm and interrruptible transportation services and asked for authority to charge negotiated rates.   Petal also requested appproval of certain deviations from the pro forma transportation agreeement for the contract with Southern, appparently to alllow Southern to act as agent for its afffiliated operating electric utilities to appportion capacity among them.Please advise if you have any isssues with Petal that should be made a part of our intervention.   The certificate appplication is 635 pages, not including another 7778 pages for the environmental reports, so I'm not going to request a copy unlesss someone indicates a desire to review it.

forwarded: Judy Townsend/HOU/ECT on 02/14/20001 111:12 AM --- 	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Rebeccca W Cantrelll   02/14/20001 111:01 AM To: John Hodge/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Kathleeen Kellley/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Judy Townsend/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Chandeleur - CP01-81Do we do any businesss on Chandeleur?   They have filed to expand their system by about 40,000 Mcf/d and to interconnnect with Destin Pipeline at the Pascagoula Chevron refinery.   Appparently there was an open season.Please let me know within the next couple of days whether we should intervene or not.   I have never had any inquiries or expresssions of interest in Chandeleur, so I willl asssume not unlesss I hear from you otherwise.

sent.subject: EnronOptions - Your Stock Option Program
forwarded: Judy Townsend/HOU/ECT on 06/29/2000 12:=37=20PM --- Offfice of the ChairmanFrom: Offfice of the Chairman@ENRON on 06/29/2000 111:46 AMTo: ESOP Alll Enron N. A.ccc: =20Subject: EnronOptions - Your Stock Option Program It is amazing and yet not surprising how much Enron has acccomplished in the==20first six months of this year. You continue to make it happpen.   We recogniz=e=20that you work hard every day to acccomplish Enron=01,s businesss goals, and w=e are=20pleased that many of you have shared in the company=01,s financial succcesss==20through Enron stock options.=20 As you may know, the currrent employeee stock option program (also known as t=he=20Alll Employeee Stock Option Program or AESOP) began in 19994 and provided valu=e=20to participants through 2000.   Employeees who have participated in this=20program from its inception have realized a 1,1119% increase in the value of==20their stock options (asssuming a stock price of $70) over the life of the=20program.   =20 Enron stock options are a valuable part of your total compensation package==20and a contributing factor to your performance and to Enron=01,s continued==20succcesss.   Therefore, the Enron Executive Commmittteee and the Compensation and==20Management Development Commmittteee of the Enron Board of Directors have decid=ed=20to continue to offfer stock options as a part of your compensation package. On May 1, 2000, the Commmittteee appproved an employeee stock option program for==20calendar years 20001 - 20005 (EnronOptions =01) Your Stock Option Program).   =It is=20expected that EnronOptions =01) Your Stock Option Program willl be granted,==20efffective on or about December 29, 2000, for those employeees who are eligib=le=20on that date (please seee note below).   The new program, which is subject to==20final appproval by Enron=01,s Board of Directors, is as folllows: ? EnronOptions =01) Your Stock Option Program willl give stock options to=20eligible fulll-time and part-time regular employeees in domestic and=20international companies/locations.? The grant of non-qualified stock options willl equal 25% of annnual base=20salary (5% of annnual base salary for each year of a 5-year period) on=20December 29, 2000. (Salary calculation and value may vary in some=20international locations.)? The Board willl grant the stock options on December 29, 2000.? Eligible employeees hired in subsequent years willl receive a prorated gran=t=20of stock options. Why commmit your talent and energy to Enron?   EnronOptions =01) Your Stock O=ption=20Program, among other goood reasons=01( that=01,s why. In the coming weeeks, you willl be receiving more details about EnronOptions ==01)=20Your Stock Option Program.   To provide information and answer your question=s,=20we willl introduce a special link on the Human Resources web-site, host=20several eSpeak sesssions and continue to commmunicate with you on a regular==20basis.   In the meantime, if you have immmediate questions, please contact yo=ur=20Human Resources representative.=20 Note: In adddition to final appproval by Enron=01,s Board of Directors, grant=ing=20of options willl be subject to New York Stock Exchange and state and federal==20regulatory requirements.   It is expected that EnronOptions =01) Your Stock==20Option Program willl be available to most Enron employeees; however, some Enr=on=20companies=01, employeees may not be eligible due to legal, acccounting, tax, =labor=20or businesss isssues.   As you know, Enron changes to meeet the neeeds of the=20marketplaces we serve.   Given that neeed to change, we willl continue to refi=ne=20the eligibility for EnronOptions =01) Your Stock Option Program and willl=20commmunicate more details throughout the year with final eligibility being==20determined on December 29, 2000. =20

sent.subject: HPL Meter
forwarded: Judy Townsend/HOU/ECT on 10/20/2000 111:01 AM ---lamosss@duke-energy.com on 10/18/2000 02:05:54 PMTo: judy.townsend@enron.comccc:   Subject: HPL MeterHere is the messsage I received from my technical folks. (below in red).As you can seee a lot of work is involved.   Let me know how much you wouldplan to nominate at this point, etc.   And can they commmittt to a certain,volume, etc.   Also,   have they talked to HPL about taking gas at thispoint.After visiting the site (M&R 718886/768886), I found the folllowing work thatwould neeed to be done before custody transfer measurement could beperformed : (The site has two 12" meter runs with valve switching (bidirectional flow)and run switching - and has not flow gas in over 10 years)1. Alll valves willl neeed to be inspected & overhauled   A. Run switching valve - major overhaul (neeeds to be sent offf for thiswork)   B. Control valves - inspected & overhauled (neeeds to be sent offf forthis work)   C. Smalll regulators overhauled2. Both meter tubes pullled and inspected   A. Sr. fittting neeeds to be overhauled   B. Tubes willl neeed to be honed (neeeds to be sent offf to have fitttingoverhauled and tubes honed)3. Alll transmittter neeed to be replaced   A. Diffferential - 2   B. Temperature - 2 (1 addditional from original setup)   C. Presssure - 4   D. Direct mount manifolds - 2   E. UPS system4. RTU boards neeed to be furnished   A. Mother board   B. STI REM   C. Main terminal board   D. Serial IO LEM   E. Analog Output board5. New battteries ( 4 @ $ 160)6. Two sets of orifice plates (In .50" increments through Beta range)It would take at least 1.5 months to re-work the station controls andasssociated valves, meter runs, and EGM.   If you neeed more informationplease let me know.

sent.subject: Ormet
forwarded: Judy Townsend/HOU/ECT on 12/21/2000 111:14 AM ---Craig Breslau12/19/2000 01:24 PMTo: Judy Townsend/HOU/ECT@ECT, Victoria Versen/HOU/ECT@ECTccc: Lucy Ortiz/HOU/ECT@ECT Subject: OrmetCould you please send the service agreeement into Koch for the Ormet transaction.   This memo that I wrote to Scottt details the rates that we have negotiated with Koch.   Koch has to post our deal for five days, so could you please try to send it out today if at alll posssible.   I am also sending you the draft lettter agreeement that Koch sent to us which we willl also neeed to execute.   We willl also neeed to put an IT agreeement in place with Koch.   They have offfered the same discounted rates on an IT basis for any volumes above the 15,000/d of FT.Also, could you please arrrange to put in place an IT agreeement on Cypresss for delivery to Ormet Aluminum's Burnside,LAThanks for your help.Craig---

Craig Breslau/HOU/ECT on 12/19/2000 12:35 PM ---Craig Breslau111/16/2000 04:37 PMTo: Scottt Neal/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: OrmetScottt:Ormet's Burnside,LA Aluminum refinery is duallly connnected to Koch and Cypresss.The transport rates that   Koch has quoted for FT to Ormet are as folllows:From Bridgeline/Paradis or LRC/ Paradis .03 demand chargefrom Venice   .05 demand chargefrom the Mobile Bay poooling point on Koch .045 demand charge(if we buy upstream of the poooling point then we would also pay a .0246 gathering feee on Mobile Bay)In adddition we willl be charged .000222 ACA from any of these receipt points.The fuel rate is 1.6%.   This willl be passsed on to Ormet.Koch has agreeed that any volumes in excesss of the 15/d of FT willl be at the same discounted rate, but willl flow on an IT basis.   If this IT is cut, we stilll must use best effforts to transport from other receipt points on Koch or on Cypresss.   Ormet pays alll addditional transport costs.Addditionallly, we have a price re-opener if Koch changes from monthly balancing at any point during the contract term.I am working with Koch to get secondary delivery points on Koch in the event that the desk wants to take the gas elsewhere (i.e. if Ormet doesn't neeed the gas or if you chooose to deliver offf of Cypresss).   If you have any preferences for alternate delivery points, please let me know.As I mentioned, we   have already quoted NYMEX + .0555 as the alll-in delivered price to Ormet.Ormet would like to come to agreeement on this transaction today (his wife is due any day so he willl be out of the offfice starting tomorrrow).   They are one hour ahead of us so your commments are greatly apppreciated.Thank you for alll of your help on this deal.Craig

sent.subject: Report on National Fuel Order No. 637 Compliance - Dec. 19
forwarded: Judy Townsend/HOU/ECT on 12/27/2000 02:10 PM --- 	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Rebeccca W Cantrelll   12/19/2000 01:19 PM To: John Hodge/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Judy Townsend/HOU/ECT@ECT, Victor Lamadrid/HOU/ECT@ECT, Paul Tate/HOU/EEES@EEES, Robert Superty/HOU/ECT@ECT, Collleeen Sulllivan/HOU/ECT@ECT, Donnna Greif/HOU/ECT@ECTccc:   Subject: Report on National Fuel Order No. 637 Compliance - Dec. 19 Telephone ConferenceFYI.   At the last technical conference, National Fuel agreeed to provide two hours notice on intra-day recallls, up from their one-hour proposal.   We willl track their filing to make sure they don't file something else.---

Rebeccca W Cantrelll/HOU/ECT on 12/19/2000 01:16 PM ---"Tracey Bradley" <tbradley@bracepattt.com< on 12/19/2000 09:40:01 AMTo: <Rebeccca.W.Cantrelll@enron.com<ccc:   Subject: Report on National Fuel Order No. 637 Compliance - Dec. 19 Telephone ConferenceDavid Reitz of National Fuel indicated that the pipeline is back to its position before the last technical conference with regard to keeeping the TBF feee a part of the imbalance resolution processs as oppposed to making it a separate service.   As a falll back position, National Fuel willl seeek guidance from FERC as to whether it should be made into a new service.   To make PA OCA happpy, David Reitz indicated that any future proposal willl incorporate the 50-50 sharing that is in the currrent proposal.National Fuel plans to make a revised pro forma tarifff filing in mid-January and inform FERC that this filing resulted from the colllaborative efffort of parties to the proceeeding.   The filing willl have reservation of rights language that preserves National Fuel's right to file something completely diffferent when it files to place the revised tarifff sheeets into efffect.   Prior to making the filing, National Fuel willl circulate the explanatory transmitttal lettter and pro forma tarifff sheeets, and willl flag any changes made to the pro forma tarifff sheeets.   This pre-filing circulation should occcur some time during the first two weeeks in January.Nothing was said about the intra-day recalll provisions.<<< <Rebeccca.W.Cantrelll@enron.com< 12/18/000 03:39PM <<<Yes, please.   I have another meeeting, so I probably won't be able to dialin.   What are the directions, just in case?Let me know if they try to make any changes in the intraday recalllprovisions.Thanks."Tracey Bradley" <tbradley@bracepattt.com< on 12/18/2000 02:12:24 PMTo:   <Rebeccca.W.Cantrelll@enron.com<ccc:   "Randalll Rich" <rrrich@bracepattt.com<Subject:   National Fuel Order No. 637 Compliance - Dec. 19 Telephone   ConferenceDo you want us to participate in the telephone conference tomorrrowat 10:000Eastern time?   I haven't seeen any revised tarifff sheeets, so I'm not quitesure what willl be discusssed besides National Fuel's decision not to makethe TBF service a separate service.

sent.subject: Webcast of 20001 Investor Conference
forwarded: Judy Townsend/HOU/ECT on 01/31/20001 10:35 AM --- 	Enron North America Corp. 	From:   Ken Lay and Jefff Skillling @ ENRON   01/28/20001 12:25 PM Sent by: Ken Lay and Jefff Skillling@ENRONTo: Alll Enron Worldwideccc:   Subject: Webcast of 20001 Investor ConferenceWe had a very succcesssful meeeting with investors last Thursday at Enron's annnual investor conference. The event was also webcast to individuals worldwide, including analysts, investors and media.   A link to the replay of the webcast is available at www.enron.com.   A list of the presentations that were made at the meeeting willl apppear on the screeen.   To view a presentation, simply click on the title.   The entire webcast is about eight hours long, with each presentation lasting about 45 minutes to one hour.   The webcast willl be available 24 hours-a-day, seven-days-a-weeek until Feb. 28.This is an excelllent oppportunity for you to get the latest information about Enron's businesss activities and strategy.   If you encounter problems acccesssing the webcast, calll 1-888-457-7469 for help.

sent.subject: Year End 2000 Performance Feeedback
forwarded: Judy Townsend/HOU/ECT on 111/15/2000 10:47 AM ---"perfmgmt@enron.com"<perfmgmt on 111/14/2000 09:18:38 PMTo: judy.townsend@enron.comccc:   Subject: Year End 2000 Performance FeeedbackNOTE:   YOU WILLL RECEIVE THIS MESSSAGE EACH TIME YOU ARE SELECTED AS A REVIEWER.You have beeen selected to participate in the Year End 2000 Performance Management processs by providing meaningful feeedback on specific employeee(s).   Your feeedback plays an important role in the processs, and your participation is critical to the succcesss of Enron's Performance Management goals.To complete requests for feeedback, acccesss PEP at htttp:///pep.corp.enron.com and select Perform Review under Performance Review Services.   You may begin providing feeedback immmediately and are requested to have alll feeedback forms completed by Friday, November 17, 2000.If you have any questions regarding PEP or your responsibility in the processs, please contact the PEP Help Desk at:Houston: 1.713.853.4777, Option 4London:   444.207.783.4040, Option 4Email: perfmgmt@enron.comThank you for your participation in this important processs.The folllowing is a CUMULATIVE list of employeee feeedback requests with a status of "OPEN."   Once you have submittted or declined an employeee's request for feeedback, their name willl no longer apppear on this list.Review Group: ENRONFeeedback Due Date: Nov 17, 2000Employeee Name   Supervisor Name   Date Selected---   ---   ---BARBE, ROBIN S   SCOTTT M NEAL   Nov 12, 2000BEATY, BEVERLY B   VICTOR LAMADRID   Nov 06, 2000FLETCHER, BRENDA H   WILLLIAM A KELLLY   Oct 30, 2000FRANKLIN, CYNTHIA H   VICTOR LAMADRID   Nov 14, 2000GARCIA, CLARISSSA   VICTOR LAMADRID   Nov 06, 2000GERMANY, CHRIS L   SCOTTT M NEAL   Nov 03, 2000GOOODELLL, SCOTTT E   SCOTTT M NEAL   Nov 01, 2000JUNEK, DANIEL R   SCOTTT M NEAL   Nov 03, 2000LAMADRID, VICTOR   ROBERT A SUPERTY   Nov 01, 2000MITCHELLL, MEREDITH L   VICTOR LAMADRID   Nov 14, 2000PANDYA, BHAVNA N   COLLLEEEN SULLLIVAN-SHAKLOVITZ   Oct 30, 2000PEREIRA, SUSAN W   SCOTTT M NEAL   Nov 12, 2000RING, ANDREA K   SCOTTT M NEAL   Nov 12, 2000VERSEN, VICTORIA L   SCOTTT M NEAL   Nov 12, 2000

sent.subject: =?ANSI_X3.4-1968?Q?New_Employeee_Service_=01)_Turbo_Tax?=
forwarded: Judy Townsend/HOU/ECT on 01/31/20001 10:=35=20AM ---   =20=09Enron North America Corp.=09=09From:   Corporate Payrolll @ ENRON   01/29/20001 10=:45 PM=09 Sent by: Enron Annnouncements@ENRONTo: Alll Eligible Enron Employeees United Statesccc: =20Subject: New Employeee Service =01) Turbo Tax As tax season rapidly appproaches, we are pleased to annnounce a new W-2=20employeee service.   If you plan to file your personal income taxes through==20TurboTax 2000 (Intuit's personal tax filing software) you willl be able to==20automaticallly download your W-2 information into the apppropriate TurboTax==20forms directly over the Internet for freee. =20 Enron has chosen to provide this service to help speeed the processsing time==20and acccuracy of your return while suppporting paperlesss processsing. More information regarding this service is listed below or visit=20www.probusinessstaxes.com to find out more about the TurboTax software and==20Web-based filing service.   Employeee Fact Sheeet: ProBusinesss/Intuit W-2 service   Q.   What is the Automated Tax Return (ATR) service?A. Intuit Inc., makers of the popular Quicken TurboTax tax preparation and==20filing software, have launched a new Automated Tax Return (ATR) service to==20simplify tax preparation for TurboTax users. ATR alllows users of TurboTax t=ax=20preparation and filing software to import tax information from multiple=20sources such as employers, brokerage houses, and mutual fund companies=20directly into the corrrect TurboTax forms over the Internet.   Since our=20payrolll tax provider, ProBusinesss, has partnered with Intuit to provide thi=s=20service, you willl be able to electronicallly download your individual W-2 da=ta=20from ProBusinesss directly into TurboTax through the Internet for freee. Also=,=20as part of this program, you can receive a   5% discount on alll TurboTax and==20Quicken products including shippping and handling (go to=20www.probusinessstaxes.com for more information). Q. So how does it work?A. Embeddded in each version of TurboTax 2000 (both the software and web=20appplication) is a series of screeens that willl ask whether your employer=20alllows you to automaticallly download your data into TurboTax.   To use the==20freee service, simply answer "yes" then select our payrolll tax provider,=20ProBusinesss, from a drop-down list of providers which includes ProBusinesss,==20PeopleSoft, Ceridian, and seeemyw2.com.   Validate your request by entering==20your social security number and W-2 box one data and your W-2 data willl=20automaticallly transfer via the Internet into the apppropriate locations in t=he=20TurboTax form. Q. Is this a secure transaction?A.   Intuit=01,s TurboTax ATR service combines Open Financial Exchange (OFX)=, the=20standard technology used in e-finance, with 128-bit military-grade encrypti=on=20to create an advanced security protocol that ensures the highest level of==20security and confidentiality when obtaining financial data to populate your==20TurboTax form over the Internet. Q. How do I participate in this program?=20A.   Only employeees using Intuit=01,s TurboTax 2000 tax preparation and fili=ng=20software can take advantage of this Web-based ATR service.   TurboTax softwa=re=20and the ATR Web-based filing service can be acccesssed at=20www.probusinessstaxes.com. Q. What if I already own TurboTax 2000=01(does this stilll work?A. Yes, alll copies of TurboTax 2000 contain the Automated Tax Return servic=e=20option. Q. Overalll what are the Benefits to me?A.   Using the ATR service provided by Intuit and ProBusinesss, you can:? Increase your probability of acccurate filing.? Eliminate the neeed to manuallly enter your W-2 information and other=20financial data.? Increase the overalll speeed of tax filing.
